creature.title: Blood Hawk

block.name: Claw Rake
block.line: Attack: Melee 1 (one creature); +5 vs. AC
Hit: 1d6 + 3 damage, and ongoing 2 damage (save ends), or ongoing 5 damage if the blood hawk is bloodied.
If the target is bloodied, it takes a -2 penalty to the saving throw.

block.name: Flyby Attack
block.line: Effect: The blood hawk flies 6 squares and makes a Claw Rake at any points during that movement.
The blood hawk does not provoke opportunity attacks from the target of the attack when moving.

creature.description: Blood hawks are aggressive hunters that use their razor-sharp claws to inflict grievous wounds

creature.title: Dire Rat

block.name: Small and Evasive
block.line: The dire rat has a +2 bonus to all defenses against attacks triggered by its movement.

block.name: Bite
block.line: Attack: Melee 1 (one creature); +6 vs. AC
Hit: 1d6 + 2 damage, and additional 1d6 damage if no other enemies are adjacent to the dire rat.

Disease: The target must attempt a saving throw at the end of the encounter. On a failure, it contracts dire rat filth fever (stage 1). If the target was hit by a critical hit or while bloodied, the target must roll twice and use the lower result.

creature.description: Dire rats are stealthy creatures that like to hunt in small packs, sneaking up on prey and ganging up on one creature at a time

affliction.title: Dire Rat Filth Fever
affliction.fluff: Those afflicted with this disease waste away as they alternately suffer chills and hot flashes

stage.name: Stage 0:
stage.text: The target recovers from the disease.

stage.name: Stage 1:
stage.text: The target loses a healing surge, and its maximum number of healing surges is reduced by 1.

stage.name: Stage 2:
stage.text: The target loses two healing surges, and its maximum number of healing surges is reduced by 2. The target also takes a -2 penalty to AC, Fortitude, and Reflex.

stage.name: Stage 3:
stage.text: The target loses all healing surges, cannot regain healing surges, and cannot regain hit points. The target also takes a -2 penalty to AC, Fortitude, and Reflex.

check.text: While at Stage 1 or Stage 2, the target makes an Endurance check at the end of each extended rest.

result.text: The stage of the disease increases by 1.
The stage of the disease decreases by 1.

creature.title: Horse, Charger

block.name: Charger
block.line: Requirement: Mounted by a friendly rider of 1st level or higher.
The charger's rider gains a +3 bonus to damage rolls on charge attacks.

block.name: Kick
block.line: Attack: Melee 1 (one creature); +4 vs. AC
Hit: 2d6 + 4 damage.

block.name: Trample
block.line: Effect: The horse moves up to its speed, and can move through the space of enemies that are smaller size than it is.
Each time the horse enter's an enemy's space for the first time during the move, it makes the following attack against that enemy:
Attack: Melee 0 (one creature); +4 vs. Fortitude
Hit: 2d8 + 4 damage, and the enemy falls prone.
Miss: Half damage if the target was already prone.

creature.description: Unlike riding horses, chargers are trained for battle and when ridden aggressively, they lash out with their hooves or trample foes underfoot

creature.title: Horse, Riding

block.name: Kick
block.line: Attack: Melee 1 (one creature); +4 vs. AC
Hit: 1d6 + 4 damage.

block.name: Nimble Mount
block.line: Requirement: Mounted by a friendly rider of 1st level or higher.
Effect: The horse shifts 2 squares.

creature.description: Riding horses usually panic when faced with danger, striking out with their hooves only when trapped or startled
